inputs.task: Design and improve the LaunchBase homepage from first principles
inputs.whitePaper:
LaunchBase is an operating system for small businesses.
Not a website builder. Not another tool. Not a one-time agency project.

LaunchBase is ongoing ownership of a business's digital operating layer:
- website uptime + maintenance
- lead capture + forms
- monitoring + safety decisions
- updates + publishing cadence
- integrations + visibility
- logging + accountability

LaunchBase exists because most small businesses already have tools, but no one owns the system.
They have a website, a payment tool, a calendar, a Google profile, and logins…
…but the owner still carries the burden of making sure everything works.

LaunchBase sells relief from that cognitive load.

Core customer pain: The customer isn't buying a website. They're buying the ability to stop thinking about:
- "Is it still working?"
- "Did that form actually send?"
- "What should I post?"
- "Is anything broken?"
- "Am I missing something?"

This is background anxiety, not a feature gap.
The enemy is not "lack of tools."
The enemy is lack of ownership.

LaunchBase replaces the customer as the default system-checker.

Promise:
✅ Change is reversible
✅ Non-action is safe
✅ Silence is a valid decision
✅ Every action is logged
✅ Customer sees their real site before paying
✅ LaunchBase acts only after approval

The brand is accountability.
LaunchBase is responsibility-as-a-service.

Target customer:
- owner-operator
- service business
- small team
- not "tech obsessed"
- wants a business to run, not to "manage tools"

Tone: calm, competent, honest, operationally serious, safety-first, premium but not flashy.
This is a systems product, not a "creative brand party."

Design objective:
✅ Create instant trust
✅ Communicate the contract clearly
✅ Show the "safe-by-default" nature
✅ Make "Hand It Off" feel low-risk
✅ Explain observability in plain English
✅ Look premium enough to justify recurring ownership

currentCopy.hero: Stop carrying the system in your head. Hand it off. Keep visibility.
currentCopy.problem: No one owns the system. You're the fallback for everything.
currentCopy.solution: LaunchBase becomes the owner. You stay informed, not involved.
currentCopy.trust: Safe by default. Fully logged. Reversible.

inputs.audience: Owner-operators of service businesses (fitness studios, coffee shops, consulting firms) who want stability and accountability, not tool management
inputs.tone: Calm, minimal, trustworthy, premium. Avoid hype. Avoid 'AI magic.' Avoid exaggerated claims.
inputs.constraints: Mobile-first. Must feel like 'responsibility-as-a-service.' Must emphasize safety, reversibility, observability. Must reduce mental load while reading.

proposedChanges.value: Add a concise bullet list of three core promises under the headline to immediately communicate key benefits and reduce cognitive load.
proposedChanges.rationale: This will enhance clarity above the fold and quickly inform visitors of the main benefits.
risks: May clutter the hero section if not designed well

proposedChanges.value: Combine the problem and solution into a single two-column section with problem on the left and solution on the right for direct comparison.
proposedChanges.rationale: This layout will improve scannability and make the connection between the problem and solution more immediate.
risks: Could overwhelm users if too text-heavy

proposedChanges.value: Implement a sticky primary CTA on mobile that appears after scrolling past the hero section.
proposedChanges.rationale: Keeps the CTA in view, encouraging conversion without disrupting content consumption.
risks: Could be perceived as intrusive if not subtle

proposedChanges.value: Convert pricing tables into card format with one highlighted default tier that includes 'what you get' bullets.
proposedChanges.rationale: Card format is easier to parse and quickly highlights the recommended option, simplifying decision-making.
risks: Highlighting one tier may discourage examination of others

proposedChanges.value: Place a trust band with key trust elements (safe, logged, reversible) right before the pricing section.
proposedChanges.rationale: Reinforces trust before the pricing decision, aligning with the product's accountability promise.
risks: Potentially interrupts the flow if too emphasized

proposedChanges.value: Ensure consistent spacing between sections to maintain a calm, readable flow.
proposedChanges.rationale: Consistent spacing will reduce cognitive load and make the page feel more organized.
risks: Excessive spacing could lead to unnecessary scrolling

proposedChanges.value: Optimize all sections for mobile by prioritizing vertical stacking and reducing text where possible.
proposedChanges.rationale: Mobile-first design ensures accessibility and ease of use for all users.
risks: Reduced content may miss some desktop details

proposedChanges.value: Reorder sections so that the 'How It Works' segment follows the hero section immediately to quickly explain the process.
proposedChanges.rationale: Early positioning of process explanation can reduce uncertainty and improve engagement.

proposedChanges.value: Use 48px H1 (mobile: 32px) with line-height 1.1 for hero headline to create calm, confident tone
proposedChanges.rationale: Larger, well-spaced headlines convey confidence and calmness, setting a premium tone.
risks: May require adjustments in mobile layout to maintain aesthetics

proposedChanges.rationale: Generous spacing improves readability and reduces cognitive load, aligning with the calm and operational tone.
risks: Could lead to excessive scrolling on smaller screens

proposedChanges.value: Use pill-shaped buttons with 16px padding, subtle shadow, no gradients
proposedChanges.rationale: Simple, tactile buttons are easy to interact with and fit the premium, operational aesthetic.
risks: May not stand out enough if not paired with contrasting colors

proposedChanges.value: Add 3-chip row below hero: 'Safe by default • Fully auditable • Reversible changes'
proposedChanges.rationale: Trust chips immediately communicate key promises, reinforcing safety-first and accountability.
risks: May add visual complexity if not properly spaced

proposedChanges.value: Ensure all text has a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1
proposedChanges.rationale: High contrast enhances readability and accessibility, aligning with the trustworthy tone.

proposedChanges.value: Include an audit log preview pattern with timestamps and action descriptions
proposedChanges.rationale: Provides transparency and reinforces the 'fully logged' promise, increasing user trust.
risks: May overwhelm users if not designed with care

proposedChanges.value: Use a muted color palette with blues and grays to evoke calm and stability
proposedChanges.rationale: A restrained palette supports the operationally serious and premium brand tone without being flashy.
risks: Could appear too bland if not balanced with accents

proposedChanges.value: Implement card style with minimal shadow and 12px padding for density
proposedChanges.rationale: Dense but readable cards add structure and maintain the operational feel, supporting cognitive ease.
risks: May require adjustments for content-heavy cards to maintain readability
No design output was provided to evaluate
assumptions: This appears to be input data only, not a Craft output for review

swarm.reason: Missing craft or critic artifact for collapse
